Zuma reached orbit, as evidenced by Space-Track adding the satellite to their registry. This directly contradicts the news reported by the WSJ which said "Secret payload code-named Zuma failed to reach orbit". The guy who wrote the article previously got a fact about Space-X by more than an order of a magnitude and was scorned by Elon Musk. I think news outlets are using the fact no one can contradict them (due to secrecy) in order to create a popular story with no basis. Plus, you would think falcon heavy would get delayed if there was any problem whatsoever.

FYI, the main problem with rotation (gravity) is that NASA requires backup plans. Any problem that causes the rotation to fail also causes the ship to tumble uncontrollably and the systems to stop the tumble would be the exact ones the broke to cause the tumble. There is no way to recover the crew in a ship that is tombing.

A side note is also the problem of micro meteriors hitting the connecting wire. Fault tolerance means multiple wires and the you get deployment problems. All these problems can be solved by complex system but complex systems are prone to problems and all the extras needed to make it work adds a lot of weight. Dispute the research on this, There is no system that's remotely close to being reliable and safe. So it's basically shelved until someone comes up with a eureka moment.

Other alternative is cheap easy launch and assembly of a 25 foot (30 for general population) solid ring with a 2-7 day period for people to adjust do the coriolis effect. Currently look to the advancements inflatable sections.

Your explanation of Sonic Booms is wrong.  you get a sonic boom STARTING at trans sonic.  once you're above mach 1 you have a continuous sonic boom wave at the nose of the rocket (or at the leading edge of any object).
